outputs.output_descr: The above project has been created  as part of the Country Office initiatives to ensure discrete and distinct support outside the framework of other UNDP assisted project in order not to overlap policy and capacity development for management efficiency related technical assistance to the different Ministries, government departments, and civil society. Through this project has introduced a demand driven mechanisms responsive to the needs in the areas of policy analysis and development, which will  facilitate different stakeholders to have access to resources and technical assistance in order to prepare policy analysis based investment proposals, support to policy analysis and development of policy options and institution development through management efficiency and organizational structure review. The technical assistance will be focused in the following areas: 1) Policy Analysis and Policy Advisory support/service; 2) Capacity Development and 3) Management efficiency and institutional development. It is envisaged that the initiatives will facilitate the momentum of poverty reduction on the back of reforms of governance and economic policies such as analyze and develop private sector policies and support in designing investment proposals/projects and support to develop strategic planning, poverty diagnostics and analysis and assisting with MDGs, thereby contributing to implement the Afghanistan National Development Strategy (ANDS).  A request from the Government (dt. 29 October 2008 annexure - 1) was received by UNDP to initiate the project under Direct Implementation Modality. The Initiation Plan was approved by the Country Director on 3rd November 2008. In late 2008 consultation with various ministries were held and a list of Sub-Implementing Partners were identified and approved by the LPAC dated 17 December 2008. Accordingly UNDP is signing the LOAs with the partners. Hence, the budget needs a revision to reflect the activities to be undertaken in 2009.
